page.title: 01BUILDINGS
page.content: THE BUILDINGS of the area are concentrated in two areas. One, district in the south, known as Farington, and two, the larger of the two areas, Lostock Hall in the north of the area. The majority of the buildings are new, less than twenty years of age. The older building were usually ribbon development following the major routes of transport. In the recent past larger estates have been built. All the houses are of brick. Brick patterns are mainly stretch boor English Garden. Recent houses also rendered finishes. Windows in the main are casement. Over 80%of the houses have central heating with gas being the m ain fuel. Gardens are all small.-usually lawned with the older properties only having yards.
